column4: lspci is not identifying my network card, anyone have an idea how I can find it?
is it PCI? or USB?  lsusb
its pci
lsmod?
what am I looking for in this?
there does not appear to be anything there relative to the network card.
lsmod gives less descriptive names.  You can use process of elimination to find your card.  Yes if a module were loaded, the card would be present.
what interfaces shown in 'ip addr'?
there isnt one
does it not at least show 'lo'?
'lo' is the loopback network interface.  it should always be present & seen as a result of 'ip link'
there are ip_table* shown
not in lsmod.  run the program 'ip' with parameter 'link'
what am I lookig for?
are you chatting from your  Ubuntu box that has the trouble?
wmaster0, wlan0, pan0
no, I don't have wireless here
it shows your wireless card.
the driver I need is only on one website, which happens to be down
do you know what brand the ethernet is?
was the ethernet working under a previous linux?
in the worst case, you install the old linux where it was working; extract the information about the card; use information in KK to set it up
it was found under 9.04, and it was found under my old installation of 9.10. The card is Atheros AR1831, but the driver site is down..
